answers.answer: Hi,Are there any other associated symptoms like increase in urinary frequency or pain in urination? Do you experience back pain?Have you been diagnosed with a urinary tract infection before?Do you need to strain on urination?Any changes in the character of your urine (dark tea colored urine for instance)?Have you had any previous surgeries or instrumentation?Any underlying disorders like diabetes and hypertension?Do you spill urine when coughing or laughing?Do you wake at night to urinate? If yes, how many times?These are just questions to clarify some things with regards to your condition. Do keep us posted with your answers.

question: I am feeling that I am dripping, but it is just  a sensation. When I get the sensation, I go to the bathroom and I can urinate, but nothing in the amount that would suggest the feeling of urgency that I experience. After urinating, the sensation goes away, but it often returns about 15 minutes later and I usually continue to have the sensation until I urinate again. I get the sensation most often when I am at work sitting at a desk or leaning over a table. What may be the problem and what should I do? What is the remedy?
title: pkpandya4ds@gmail.com
